meanings.definition: A protein that regulates muscle contraction by blocking the myosin-binding sites on actin.
meanings.sent1: The tropomyosin helps control how muscles move by stopping myosin from binding to actin.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study tropomyosin to understand how muscles work.
meanings.sent3: The tropomyosin protein is like a traffic cop directing muscle movements.
meanings.sent4: In the dance of muscle contraction, tropomyosin acts as a gatekeeper, allowing only specific movements.
meanings.sent5: Imagine tropomyosin as a tiny gatekeeper deciding which muscle actions can pass through.

meanings.definition: A key component of the thin filaments in muscle cells.
meanings.sent1: Tropomyosin is an important part of the thin threads in muscle cells.
meanings.sent2: The structure of muscle cells relies on tropomyosin for strength.
meanings.sent3: The tiny tropomyosin plays a big role in the strength of muscle fibers.
meanings.sent4: Like a thread in a tapestry, tropomyosin weaves through muscle cells, providing support.
meanings.sent5: Picture tropomyosin as the thread holding together the delicate fabric of muscle cells.

meanings.definition: Plays a crucial role in the regulation of muscle contraction.
meanings.sent1: Tropomyosin is vital for controlling how muscles contract.
meanings.sent2: Athletes need tropomyosin to ensure their muscles work properly during exercise.
meanings.sent3: The superhero of muscle function, tropomyosin swoops in to save the day.
meanings.sent4: Tropomyosin acts like a conductor, orchestrating the symphony of muscle movements.
meanings.sent5: Tropomyosin is the guardian of muscle balance, ensuring smooth and coordinated contractions.
